document_data.name: Hue of midnight darkness
document_data.mainbody:
{{quote|''Seek the hue of midnight darkness beneath the sea of salt.''|[[Kazerabet]], through ''[[legend lore]]''.}}


'''Hue of midnight darkness''' was a tree whose wood was used in the creation of [[magical item]]s. It was only known to grow in [[Moradask]], within the [[Haunted Lands]] of [[Zakhara]].
document_data.Description: The wood grew as a bamboo-like plant, with solid black gnarled wood, sprouting networks of white, pallid leaves.
document_data.Cultivation: Hue of midnight darkness only grew in very specific environments, requiring darkness, moisture, salt, and specific magical emanations.{{cite book/Cities of Bone/Adventure Book|63}}
document_data.Powers: The wood drained magic from its surroundings, [[dispel magic|dispelling]] magic within {{SI|30|feet|long=yes}} quite powerfully while live.
document_data.Usage: Once dried, the wood could be enchanted to make staves that held half again as many charges. Furthermore, the process of [[enchant an item|enchanting]] was far more likely to succeed on staves made of hue of midnight darkness.
document_data.History:
In the late mid-14{{th}} century [[DR]], the necromancess [[Kazerabet]] sought hue of midnight darkness to enchant a ''[[staff of the magi]]''.{{cite book/Cities of Bone/Adventure Book|52}} All she could determine about the ingredient through ''[[legend lore]]'' was "seek the hue of midnight darkness beneath the Sea of Salt". She may have resorted to underhanded methods to secure the cooperation of [[adventurer]]s, or she may have offered to enchant two items if they brought enough of the wood.{{cite book/Cities of Bone/Adventure Book|54}}

It is possible the adventurers may have found a patch of such wood in an underground chamber, beneath the ruins of [[Moradask]], a mile beneath the earth, accessible from the [[Temple of Ishistu]] within the city: this was the abode of the [[kraken]] [[Ur, the Great Squid]].{{cite book/Cities of Bone/Adventure Book|64}}
